intro: Tilia longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed lime or the eastern lime, is a deciduous tree native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Tiliaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, yellowish-green flowers. The tree produces small, round fruits that contain three seeds each. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones and along stream banks. Tilia longipes is valued for its ornamental qualities and historical use in traditional medicine.
